meanings.definition: To mark with a tick or ticks.
meanings.sent1: I ticked each item on the list as completed.
meanings.sent2: She ticked off the boxes on the form.
meanings.sent3: The teacher ticked the correct answers with a red pen.
meanings.sent4: The clock ticked away the seconds of the exam.
meanings.sent5: The painter carefully ticked the edges of the canvas before starting.

meanings.sent1: The old clock ticked loudly in the silent room.
meanings.sent2: The keyboard ticked as she typed her essay.
meanings.sent3: The rain ticked gently on the windowpane.
meanings.sent4: Her heels ticked on the marble floor as she walked.
meanings.sent5: The gears of the machine ticked rhythmically as it operated.

meanings.sent1: He was ticked when his plans got canceled.
meanings.sent2: She gets ticked off when people talk during movies.
meanings.sent3: I can't help but feel ticked when my brother borrows my things without asking.
meanings.sent4: The customer was ticked at the long wait in line.
meanings.sent5: Don't get ticked if things don't go as planned; stay calm.
